content:
Moving a profile moves the local folders. It is that simple.

Unfortunately most of the issues arise when the new install asked for account details and folk supply them all their mail downloads again because the use IMAP and then they complain that their local folders did not transfer, despite than not actually doing anything to casual a transfer to occur, like actually making a copy of their existing profile, or importing it using the import feature.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Are you using the traditional mail list, or the new card view. I use list view and simply clicking the item heading in the list sorts and clicking again reverses.

The card view has no headings so I guess you are limited to the old fashioned menu item in the message list header that most turn off because it just takes space. Or you could use the traditional menu (press F10 is the menu bar is not visible) select view > sort by

content: To sort on a particular column, that column has to first be enabled in the column picker, or right-click any column to enable other columns.

content:
There is a feedback forum here https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas there is also a link to it in the Thunderbird help menu.

Then there is this old bug. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=654726 it ends with the usual positive, we are doing something. It is also typical that their is no information at all about what they are actually doing or when. You would think it was Microsoft.

Then there is a user experience list where this could be discussed I would have thought. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/ux

content:
I am tired of this, this is exactly the same issue that has occurred in Thunderbird for more than a decade and it most usually caused by antivirus programs scanning in the Thunderbird profile.

There is a properties on the right click menu in the folder, use it and select repair. It has been a standard response to misaligned indexes (which is what you are describing with wrong message or html/ message sources. The repair option has been there since V3 at least.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thank you for your kind words about Thunderbird. On your email issue, would you please redirect (not forward) the message that has Dan Sullivan as a correspondent to me at davidthunderbird at gmx dot com? That is the only way to see how the email was constructed. Otherwise, there is no way to determine if there is a flaw in Thunderbird or just an unusual email address.
creator: davidsk

content: Also, as an aside, you are using the column title of 'correspondents', which is NOT the same as FROM. I may have more information after reviewing the email, assuming you redirect it for review. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I checked the full contents of the message and the name 'Dan' appears nowhere. You stated that the display corrected itself, so all is well. Thank you.

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I have fixed the problem so here's how I did it for anyone who may see this.

Thunderbird had created an extra Inbox for some reason. I found it by sending myself an email and then expanding all of the folders in the left pane by clicking on the small arrows.

The main Inbox was saying (1) and then another Inbox saying (1) further down. I deleted the second inbox and the problem has gone!

I vaguely remember doing this years ago when I first set it up.

Now I just want Thunderbird for Android to come out :-)
creator: pgdodd61

content: Restarting fixed this

content:
Try turning off your phone. Iphones particularly will consume all available connections. Makes them look fast, but it does not do anything for interoperability.

The other possibility is the credentials being offered are not correct sao you are not actually connected so the server considers any connections to be to many. I have never heard of error message like that for IMAP, but I have had SMTP messages complaining of the message being to large, because the person was not signed in any size was to large. So just trying the possibility that similar logic might apply.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I hope you are not using \ or / in your folder names. Always a bad idea as that is the operating systems file system folder delineator, one for Linux/Unix the other for Windows. If there is a bug in the folder handling and escaping, that is almost guaranteed to find it.

But I really do not follow what you did or why.

so I HAD, 2 seperate folders. 2 folders = /primary-2023 & /2023-emails

Where did you have these folders?

I copied them to /primary-2024 & 2024-emails respectivatly

again were were they stored? where did you do this, even how did you do this.

I ran thunderbird -P and deleted 2023 and created 2024.

Why would you delete what you had before you determined that your new profile was actually working as expected. Why you would create a new profile for a calendar year I have no idea. I have been using the same Thunderbird profile for a decade. I use folders in the profile to yearly archives.

Calander was working now it is blank

You deleted the profile that contained the calendar, so I am completely lost here.
creator: MattAuSupport
